jobDescription: April 11, 2018GENERAL ANNOUNCEMENT: POSITION OPENINGFront End DeveloperWHO WE ARE:Oakland Schools is a regional service agency that offers support services to school personnel that are best delivered regionally and provide cost, size and quality advantages to those we serve. Oakland Schools is an autonomous, tax-supported public school district governed by Michigan General School Laws and is one of 56 intermediate school districts (ISDs) established in Michigan in 1962.Our organizational focus is centered on these central objectives:Increase student achievementServe diverse needs of schoolsDecrease costs/increase efficienciesSALARY DETAILS:$72,209 - $82,566 Annually / Exempt position / 12-month work yearIN THIS ROLE:Oakland Schools is looking for an experienced Front End Developer to assume responsibility for analyzing design requirements, as well as recommending and developing technical solutions to make projects scalable, maintainable, and efficient. Are you ready to take your career to the next level? If so, apply today!WHAT WE NEED:We are seeking a motivated collaborative team member to develop application front-end functionality, user interface and user experience, monitoring usage and key data collection points, validating user input, ensuring the feasibility and cross-browser compatibility of designs, create new application features and collaborate with other team members and stakeholders. In this role you will develop, code, test, and implement front-end capabilities of web applications and software solutions; monitor compliance of all Oakland Schools’ web applications with all legal licensing requirements and district web safety standards and initiate corrective action as required. These positions requires assessing new standards, technologies, trends and formulate strategies and plans for future enhancements of UI/UX functionality of Oakland School’s applications; research new ideas for layout and user experience web sites and web applications.WHAT YOU NEED:Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology or a related field plus 4-6 years of related experience; or other equivalent combination of education and experience from which comparable knowledge and abilities can be acquired.Experience in CSS, HTML5Experience in jQuery, JavaScript, JSON, AJAXExperience in Front-End development Utilizing Modern Development FrameworksExperience in Visual Studio, SharePoint DesignerExperience in Angular.js or Backbone.jsWHAT WE PROVIDE:Oakland Schools offers company paid coverage for life insurance, short and long-term disability, well-being benefits and leave days.
